title: 107_hr414
content: The Hope and Lifetime Learning credits will now be refundable. The Hope and Lifetime Learning credits are now refundable and have been moved to a new section in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Various technical amendments have been made to different sections of the Code to reflect these changes. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to replace references to "section 25A" with "section 35" in various clauses and subparagraphs. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to replace references to "section 25A" with "section 35" in multiple clauses and subparagraphs. This includes changes in section 6050S, section 6213(g)(2), and section 1324(b) of title 31, United States Code. The table of sections for subpart C of part IV of subchapter A of chapter 1 of the Code has also been updated accordingly. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to replace references to "section 25A" with "section 35" in various clauses and subparagraphs. The amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2001. Additionally, refunds of Hope and Lifetime Learning credits can now be used as collateral for short-term student loans. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 has been amended to allow eligible educational institutions to provide tuition tax credit assignment loans to taxpayers. This loan requires the taxpayer to authorize the IRS to disburse the loan amount directly to the lender from their next refund. Taxpayers eligible for tuition tax credit assignment loans include eligible students for Hope Scholarship Credit or taxpayers eligible for Lifetime Learning Credit. The maximum loan amount is $1,000 or $1,500 for first or second-year students. An origination fee of up to 5% may be charged by the educational institution providing the loan. The amendment allows educational institutions to charge an origination fee of up to 5% on tuition tax credit assignment loans, with no interest on the loan amount. If a taxpayer does not receive a refund within three years, the loan becomes due. Effective for credits claimed after December 31, 2001.
